properties.name: server.compression.enabled
properties.description: Whether response compression is enabled.

properties.name: server.compression.excluded-user-agents
properties.description: Comma-separated list of user agents for which responses should not be compressed.

properties.name: server.compression.mime-types
properties.description: Comma-separated list of MIME types that should be compressed.

properties.name: server.compression.min-response-size
properties.description: Minimum "Content-Length" value that is required for compression to be performed.

deprecation.reason: Each server behaves differently. Use server specific properties instead.

properties.name: server.http2.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP/2 support, if the current environment supports it.

properties.name: server.max-http-post-size
properties.description: Maximum size in bytes of the HTTP post content.

deprecation.reason: Use dedicated property for each container.
Deprecated for removal in Reactor Netty.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.domain
properties.description: Domain for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.http-only
properties.description: Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.max-age
properties.description: Maximum age of the cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. A positive value indicates when the cookie expires relative to the current time. A value of 0 means the cookie should expire immediately. A negative value means no "Max-Age".

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.name
properties.description: Name for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.path
properties.description: Path of the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.same-site
properties.description: SameSite setting for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.secure
properties.description: Whether to always mark the cookie as secure.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.charset
properties.description: Charset of HTTP requests and responses. Added to the "Content-Type" header if not set explicitly.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable http encoding support.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests and responses.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force-request
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests. Defaults to true when "force" has not been specified.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force-response
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP responses.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.mapping
properties.description: Mapping of locale to charset for response encoding.

properties.name: server.servlet.jsp.class-name
properties.description:
Class name of the servlet to use for JSPs. If registered is true and this class
	 * is on the classpath then it will be registered.

properties.name: server.servlet.jsp.init-parameters
properties.description: Init parameters used to configure the JSP servlet.

properties.name: server.servlet.jsp.registered
properties.description: Whether the JSP servlet is registered.

properties.name: server.servlet.path
properties.description: Path of the main dispatcher servlet.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.comment
properties.description: Comment for the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.domain
properties.description: Domain for the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.http-only
properties.description: Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.max-age
properties.description: Maximum age of the cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. A positive value indicates when the cookie expires relative to the current time. A value of 0 means the cookie should expire immediately. A negative value means no "Max-Age".

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.name
properties.description: Name of the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.path
properties.description: Path of the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.same-site
properties.description: SameSite setting for the cookie.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.cookie.secure
properties.description: Whether to always mark the cookie as secure.

properties.name: server.servlet.session.store-dir

values.description: Validate the schema, make no changes to the database.
Create the schema and destroy previous data.
Create and then destroy the schema at the end of the session.
Automatically reset the offset to the earliest offset.
Automatically reset the offset to the latest offset.
Throw exception to the consumer if no previous offset is found for the consumer's group.
Example date format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
Example date-time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
Example time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
Example date format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
Example date-time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
Example time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
